title: Disfiguring eye symptoms diminish in Graves' eye disease drug trial
funder: River Vision Development, US Food and Drug Administration, National Institutes of Health, and others
description: Graves' eye disease, also known as thyroid eye disease, takes a physical and emotional toll on patients as inflammation and tissue buildup cause the eyes to bulge painfully from their sockets. A new clinical trial led by the University of Michigan Kellogg Eye Center shows a failed cancer drug can successfully reduce eye symptoms and improve quality of life for TED patients.
